metadata.dc:author: Gómez, L C
Fracaroli, Carolina I
Lespi, P J
metadata.dc:description: Bruner's gland hyperplasia (BGH) is an infrequent benign injury located on the first or second portion of the duodenum. We presented the case of a 59 year-old man with vomits, diarrhea, upper gastrointestinal bleeding intermittent and loss of weight in which was a nodule in the duodenum that corresponded to an hyperplasia nodular of Brunner's gland.
metadata.dc:title: Hiperplasia nodular de las glándulas de Brünner: presentación de un caso y revisión de la literatura.
[Bruner's gland hyperplasia: case report and literature review].
